alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 23 at 3:36AM PDT until April 23 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...West facing shores, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, since they can be deadly locations in such conditions.
